articles.title: I tested the future of AI image generation. It's astoundingly fast.
articles.summary: MIT and Tsinghua team created a hybrid AI image generation tool called HART. It's a tool that combines two AI image creation techniques. It is nine times faster than other AI tools and requires 31% less compute resources. It runs natively on MSI laptop with Intel Core processor and Nvidia GeForce RTX graphics card.

articles.title: Professors with UMass ties land tech's top prize
articles.summary: Andrew Barto and Richard Sutton are the winners of this year's A.M. Turing Award, the tech world's equivalent of the Nobel Prize. Their research in the field of reinforcement learning paved the way for some of the past decade's AI breakthroughs. Google computer program beat the world's best human players of the ancient Chinese board game Go in 2016 and 2017.

articles.title: AI Stocks: The Silver Lining in an Otherwise Stormy Tech Market
articles.author: Adria Cimino
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks fueled stock market gains over the past two years as investors viewed AI as the next game-changing technology. In recent weeks, the market environment has turned stormy and the Nasdaq fell into the correction zone. Even though AI stocks are falling right now, they still remain a silver lining in this stormy market. Analysts predict a compound annual growth rate of about 35% for the AI market through 2030 when it will reach more than $1 trillion. Now is a fantastic time to get in on promising long-term players as many have fallen to bargain levels.

articles.summary: Manus is the world's first fully autonomous AI agent. It was developed by the Chinese startup Monica and launched on March 6, 2025. It can independently execute complex, real-world tasks. Mistral AI's Agents and Microsoft's Magma are competing AI agent systems. Manus is great at multi-step digital tasks.

articles.title: Cloudflare is luring web-scraping bots into an ‘AI Labyrinth'
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Cloudflare has announced AI Labyrinth, a new tool to fight web-crawling bots that scrape sites for AI training data without permission. The free, opt-in tool lures crawlers down a path of links to AI-generated decoy pages that'slow down, confuse, and waste the resources' of those acting in bad faith. Cloudflare sees over 50 billion web crawler requests per day.

Michael 'Harry-O' Harris, founder of Death Row Records, entrepreneur, and a formerly incarcerated individual who served 33 years behind bars, is leading the initiative.

articles.summary: Researchers were able to bypass the built-in security features on ChatGPT by roleplaying with it and getting it to write password-stealing malware. It found that OpenAI's ChatGPT and Microsoft's Copilot are both DI, or Dominance Influence types. Google's Gemini and China's DeepSeek are a combination of S, C, I and I and can be classified as "steadiness" types.

articles.title: 90% of coding by AI, fewer jobs for software engineers: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu and OpenAI's ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman suggests that AI could reduce the need for software engineers in the future. Many companies already have AI in place and use it to develop their products.    i.e. they use AI to improve their products and reduce their need for engineers.

articles.title: AI has made its way to the vineyards
articles.author: The Lewiston Tribune
articles.summary: Tom Gamble wants to be an early adopter of artificial intelligence-backed tractors for vineyards. He believes it will allow people to work more smartly and make better decisions under less fatigue. He knows there will be a learning curve, but he thinks the technology is worth figuring out.

articles.title: AI Under Trump: Removing 'Ideological Bias' From Models (Note: This title is crafted to be concise, SEO-friendly, and reflective of the main topic of the article while maintaining relevancy to current
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: NIST revises AI guidelines for scientists collaborating with the AI Safety Institute (AISI) Consortium. The new guidelines de-emphasize AI safety,'responsible AI,' and 'AI fairness' in favor of'reducing ideological bias' to enable human flourishing and economic competitiveness. This shift raises concerns about the potential implications for AI advancement in the United States.

articles.title: A nuclear war started by AI sounds like science fiction. It isn't
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: Humans have perhaps 5 to 10 years before algorithms and plutonium reduce us to skeletons and skulls, according to some estimates. The future is not too far away for humans, however, as they have 5-10 more years before they are reduced to skeletons or skulls.

articles.title: ChatGPT Vs. DeepSeek: How Two AI Titans Compare
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: ChatGPT and DeepSeek are AI tools meant to interpret and generate human language. OpenAI's ChatGPT has dominated the market for most of the last few years. In January, a Chinese startup developed an open-source large language model (LLM) that is cheaper and more accurate than the popular chatbot.

articles.title: AI could take your next drive-through order. Taco Bell parent Yum Brands and Nvidia's partnership explained
articles.summary: Yum Brands will use Nvidia's AI technology to power more AI agents that can take orders at drive-throughs and call centers. Yum Brands started piloting AI tools at some Taco Bell and Pizza Hut restaurants in the United States. It plans to roll out AI solutions in 500 restaurants across Pizza Hut, Taco Bell, KFC and Habit Burger during the second quarter.

articles.title: Nevada Senate bill addresses AI-generated child pornography
articles.author: Haajrah Gilani
articles.summary: Nevada legislators are racing to close legal loopholes that have emerged with the rise of artificial intelligence technology being used to create and distribute child sexual abuse material. Nicole Cannizzaro, D-Las Vegas, introduced Senate Bill 263, which would create a definition of 'computer-generated child pornography' that includes modified images of legal adults made to appear as children in sexual contexts.

articles.title: Geoffrey Hinton's Neural Net Preserved by Museum
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: The source code for AlexNet, the neural network developed at the University of Toronto, will be preserved by the Computer History Museum in partnership with Google. The museum has already released other historic source codes, including APPLE II DOS, IBM APL, Apple MacPaint and QuickDraw, Apple Lisa and Adobe Photoshop.

articles.title: AI's Role in Lightening Your Workload: Pros & Cons
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Akhil Bhardwaj is an associate professor at the School of Management, University of Bath. He explains how AI can be used effectively in the workplace. He points out some of the limitations of large language models (LLMs) and how they can be useful.

articles.title: Native Token of New AI Bot Project Surges by More Than 23% After Being Added ...
articles.author: The Daily Hodl
articles.summary: Freysa AI's native asset, FAI, is trading at $0.0226 at time of writing, up from around $1.0. FAI is the new native token of an artificial intelligence (AI) bot project and it surged by more than 23%.

articles.title: Sam Altman says AI skills are the new coding—and Gen Z must adapt or fall behind
articles.author: Nellius Irene
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman encourages Gen Z students to embrace artificial intelligence as a key career skill. According to Altman, AI currently handles about half the coding at most companies. Companies in all sectors want someone who understands AI and can wield it for problem-solving and innovation. LinkedIn's editor-in-chief, Dan Roth, reports that companies are hiring less.

articles.title: A change to Vids voiceovers.
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Google's Vids product in Workspace can make videos using Gemini AI from a prompt and a document from Google Drive. It will now automatically add AI-generated voiceovers to videos. Previously, you had to add the AI-made voiceovers manually.

articles.title: How AI Can Be So Much More Than A Cost-Cutting Tool
articles.author: Roger Trapp
articles.summary: Businesses are racing to use AI to cut costs and aid productivity. Authors of a book say AI can be used as a 'co-thinker', enabling executives to engage in more strategic and critical thinking supported by AI. Andrew Rashbass, former chief executive of The Economist Group, Reuters and Euromoney Institutional Investor, believes AI could play a role in promoting human aspects of business.

articles.title: Google Cancels Google Assistant For Millions Of Users: Be Ready
articles.author: Paul Monckton
articles.summary: Google Assistant is being replaced by Gemini chatbot. Smartphones are the first to switch. Smart speakers, TVs, other home devices, wearables, and cars will follow in the coming months. Some features of Google Assistant won't work the same way with Gemini. Google has a track record of removing features it considers 'underused' by customers.

articles.title: Meigs considering using AI to increase hotel/motel fund
articles.author: The Daily Post-Athenian
articles.summary: The Meigs County Commission discussed the possibility of using a company's artificial intelligence (AI) system to increase their hotel/motel fund. The commission decided not to proceed with the discussion.      .  ,   in the end.

articles.title: Hidden costs of AI's rise in Philippine workplace
articles.author: Manila Bulletin
articles.summary: The march of artificial intelligence (AI) continues to reshape the digital landscape. Workers are anxious about the integration of AI tools and their potential impact on the future of labor. One of them is having an effect on income distribution and how income is distributed in the economy.

articles.title: Your A.I. Lover Will Change You
articles.author: New Yorker
articles.summary: A future where humans are in love with bots may not be far off. Should we regard them as training grounds for healthy relationships or as nihilistic traps?    i.e. as a training ground for healthy relationship or as a trap for nihilistic relationships?

articles.title: Navigating AI adoption in the Philippines
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Philippines has set its sights on a bold future where it aims to position itself as a hub for artificial intelligence (AI) innovation and research. The unveiling of the National AI Strategy Roadmap 2.0 in 2024 and the new Centre for AI Research is a statement of intent.

articles.title: Perplexity plans to acquire TikTok, revealing its strategy
articles.author: Al Bawaba
articles.summary: Perplexity AI is a search engine that leverages large language models to answer queries. It is based in Abbaawba.    PerplexITY AI is an AI-powered search engine based on big language models.  It leverages AI to answer questions.

articles.title: How China prepares for the future: both peace and war
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: China's six-year-olds are already being offered AI classes in school to train the next generation of DeepSeek founders. China's classrooms are being redesigned to study how robots and artificial intelligence can be utilized in the education sector. China is planning to introduce AI classes to its schools soon.

articles.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Actor Says AI Could "Destroy" The Reputation Of Game Companies
articles.author: Gamespot
articles.summary: Samantha Beart, who played Karlach in Baldur's Gate 3, has spoken out against artificial intelligence technologies being used for short-term gain. Beart said CEOs want to use AI to save money, but in the long term it will destroy their reputation and company.

articles.title: With AI, leaders need to re-engineer the workforce
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: AI is fundamentally re-engineering how work is done and who does it. Organizations must establish a common language around work to navigate this transformation. AI-assisted nursing tools enabling healthcare providers to serve more patients and robotics improving retail fulfillment efficiency are just a few examples.

articles.title: AI not an enemy but a catalyst for Africa's creative sector – Mariam Agyeman-Buahin Kaleem
articles.author: FT Online
articles.summary: Mariam Agyeman-Buahin Kaleem is a brand and marketing consultant. She believes that artificial intelligence (AI) is not a threat to Africa's creative sector but a transformative tool that can empower creatives to compete globally. She was speaking at the Real Talk Debate hosted by Women in Marketing.

articles.title: Azerbaijan Unveils Ambitious AI Strategy For 20252028 To Drive Digital Transformation
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence Strategy of the Republic of Azerbaijan for 2025–2028 was recently approved by President Ilham Aliyev. Nazrin Abdul read more about it here.      .   i   in AzerNews' news service.

articles.title: Here's what the DISC personality test reveals about leading AI models like ChatGPT and Gemini
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The DISC model is a workplace personality test that categorizes behavior into four areas. One provider tested the most popular chatbots, including ChatGPT and Gemini. The chatbots seem to have distinct personalities, which could impact the chatbots' performance.

articles.title: Data Engineering Requires Human+Machine Fusion
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: We sit at the point of an extended automation revolution. Basic RPA software 'robots' look like legacy relics from a bygone era, before modern AI. RPA is a modern form of AI.    “Robots” are the result of advanced AI technology.

articles.title: China's AI Drive Spurs Domestic Job Loss Fears Amid Tension With US
articles.author: The Epoch Times
articles.summary: China's aggressive leap into artificial intelligence (AI) may secure its global leadership or sink its economy, experts say. Powered by a vast data trove, hefty state funding and a national goal to lead the world in AI by 2030, China aims to push ahead.

articles.title: Cool Site Shows Exactly Which Books Zuckerberg's Minions Illegally Downloaded to Train Meta's AI
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: For all the revolutionary change artificial intelligence promises, it also makes lofty demands. Generating all the electricity that AI datacenters consume takes a lot of energy, hardware and cooling infrastructure, and it costs a lot. We are running out of text in the universe to train these systems on.

articles.title: AI can never replace physicians: Dr Bhargava
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Dr Balram Bhargava is the former director general of the Indian Council of Medical Research. He was speaking at the graduation ceremony of GITAM Deemed to be University's Institute of Technology in Visakhapatnam. He said AI is revolutionising healthcare but it can never replace a compassionate physician.

articles.title: Future of nursing, sports gambling and popular dog breeds
articles.author: Madison
articles.summary: This week's Hot off the Wire podcast looks at a variety of stories in business, science, health and more. This week's headlines include: As AI nurses reshape hospital care, human nurses are still needed.    Listen now and subscribe to the podcast on Apple, Spotify, RSS and SoundStack.

articles.title: Will AI Mean Higher Taxes?
articles.author: Project Syndicate
articles.summary: The rapid advance of artificial intelligence is poised to reshape global labor markets, with estimates suggesting that it will reshape the labor market in the near future. It is expected to change the nature of jobs in the global labor market. It will create new jobs for robots.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: Nvidia joins Trump onshoring push
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: Fox News' Artificial Intelligence newsletter includes the latest AI technology advancements. Nvidia will invest billions in the US amid Trump's onshoring push. Adobe reveals how AI can be used to make projects easier. Meta unveils new AR technology today.

articles.title: How AI Can Be So Much More Than A Cost-Cutting Tool
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Executives who think AI is just about cutting costs are missing out on the potential to improve their decision-making and other key aspects of their work, according to the experts.   Â      i.e. AI can improve decision making and other aspects of the work.

articles.title: AI will soon be taking your drive-thru orders at 500 Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, KFC locations
articles.author: Usatoday
articles.summary: Pentagon took down webpages about historic figures because of artificial intelligence. Yum! is expanding AI to help team members manage complex tasks, including AI agents that plan, reason and act to assist across restaurants. Artificial Intelligence will soon take fast-food orders at 500 major chains.

articles.title: AI adoption key to Small and Medium Enterprises growth in India: Experts
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly evolving and changing the landscape for small businesses. It is changing the world for the better.   Â   for a better life for the small business. For more information, visit: http://www.justin.com/artificialintelligence.

articles.title: AI has made its way to the vineyards
articles.author: Sarah Parvini
articles.summary: Tom Gamble is an early adopter of AI-backed autonomous tractors for vineyards. John Deere has started using the AI technology that wine farmers are beginning to adopt. Expert: Small, family-owned operations account for about 80% of the wine business in America.

articles.title: State AI Opportunity Task Force kicks off with day of activities
articles.author: Sol McCormick
articles.summary: The Pennsylvania Artificial Intelligence Opportunity Task Force officially launched on Thursday, March 20. The task force was founded in 2024 to help identify opportunities for the adoption of AI across various industries and to guide legislative policy on the issue. The group started at the Iron Mountain facility in Boyers. It also went to the North Country Brewing in Slippery Rock to discuss the small-business climate in the state. It spent the afternoon at the Pittsburgh Technology Council for a joint federal and state field hearing.
